Package clientside.client

Class ClientMethod

  • java.lang.Object
    • clientside.client.ClientMethod
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Client, java.lang.Runnable
    public class ClientMethod
extends java.lang.Object
implements Client, java.lang.Runnable
    The class representing a client connected to a server hosting the Pentago game!

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ClientMethod​(java.io.BufferedReader br, java.io.PrintWriter pw, java.lang.String[] args)
      This method is used to create a client object!

      This method is used to access the condition gaming which indicates if the client is in a game of Pentago!

      This method is used to access the condition Helloed which indicates if the client and server have exchanged hello's!

      This method is used to access the condition inCondition which indicates if it is the client should now read the data received.

      This method is used to access the reentrant lock used by the client thread.

      This method is used to access the condition Helloed which indicates if the client has successfully logged into the server!

      This method is used to access the condition ourTurn which indicates if it is this client's turn.

      This method returns the strategy that the player has inputted, whether they choose to play for themselves or let a bot play for them.

      This method is used to access the client's username in the game!

      This method is used to access the PrintWriter usrOut which is the print writer used by the client to send the data to the server.

      This method is used to access the boolean isInGaming which indicates if a client is in a game of pentago or not!

      Sets the current player such that the user can be in track of the current player that is playing.

      This method is used to set the boolean inGaming to true if a client is in a game and to false otherwise.

      This method is used to set the boolean loggedIn to true oor false depending on if the client has logged in to the server or not!

      This method is used to set the player that they want to use during a game.
      void setQueuing​(boolean queuing)
      Sets the queuing boolean to indicate whether the player is currently attempting to queue up for a game.
      void start()
      This method is used to start the client thread! A client is connected to the server and can access various commands to play the Pentago game!

      • ClientMethod

        public ClientMethod​(java.io.BufferedReader br,
                    java.io.PrintWriter pw,
                    java.lang.String[] args)
        This method is used to create a client object!
        Parameters:
        br - This is the buffered reader that the client would use to read the incoming data
        pw - This is the printWriter that the client would use to send the data to the server!
        args - arguments made from the client

      • setMyOwnPlayer

        public void setMyOwnPlayer​(char myOwnPlayer)
        This method is used to set the player that they want to use during a game. They can either use a human player, naive random strategy, or a smarter strategy.
        Parameters:
        myOwnPlayer - for the player strategy type

      • getMyOwnPlayer

        public char getMyOwnPlayer()
        This method is used to access the char myOwnPlayer which is a char representing the current client playing the game. Used to differentiate between a human player, Naive AI player and the Smart AI player
        Returns:
        myOwn player which is a char representing this client depending on the type of player they are.

      • getLock

        public java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock getLock()
        This method is used to access the reentrant lock used by the client thread. Locks are used to allow only one thread to access a critical section at one time to avoid concurrency issues.
        Returns:
        the ReentrantLock used to ensure a thread- safe program.

      • getOwnStrategy

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
